ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  I have worked with Meredith most closely, but also Marlyse.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse always provides very helpful comments on papers and presentations. She always adds something new and constructive to the conversation. She is a really great teacher
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse gave timely comments on everything and really cares about the success of her fellow lab members. A very supportive TA.

Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Both Meredith and Marlyse are fully helpful in working through the data and writing. I need to be more outgoing in terms of getting things done, and perhaps they could have pushed me harder to meet these goals. though it is not their job.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course is a great vehicle by which one can set a time-schedule for producing manuscripts and academic journal articles.
Not sure what a field trip for this seminar might look like. Perhaps a trip to the ice cream store would be enlightening.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This course is designed to get us prepared to submit manuscripts and present our research at the colloquium. We are also involved in critiquing other students' presentations and writing, in a comfortable environment.

I liked being able to see what my life and research will look like as a second year. It was helpful to see what the research and publication process actually looks like without having to jump into it.
The scheduling of routine progress in developing a journal manuscript.

It is refreshing to be surrounded by others doing their own research, to hear what they are doing, and receive feedback and critique. Mark, Marlyse, and Meredith are extremely knowledgeable and have productive things to say.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More participation from the first years
Listening to the presentations over and over was rough. It was also rough listening to mark and the Ph.D.s give a half hour of feedback while us first years twiddled our thumbs.

Expectations are timing could be better laid out. Sometimes it felt like drafts or presentations were foisted upon us at a moment's notice. Although it was important to have these benchmarks to keep us all moving forward, this could perhaps be structured more formally beforehand.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course is necessary for conducting research in forestry and forest science
Likely more relevant than any other courses as I'm interested in research & academia.
As with my Management Plans class, this seminar offers the opportunity to take background information from prior forestry courses, and apply them towards attaining new knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Very helpful for my degree
I wanted structure and a support system for developing an academic journal.
I am excited to be conducting real research, with the goal of seeing for myself if it is something I would like to pursue further.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Listen to Mark, Marlyse, and Meredith.
Be motivated!
